findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: Hardcoded gas amounts can lead to unintended behavior and potential reentrancy vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Hash Collisions With Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This finding highlights a potential vulnerability where hash collisions can occur with multiple variable length arguments, potentially leading to authentication bypass by capture-replay attacks.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Right-To-Left- Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The U+202E Unicode character can be used to override the direction of text, potentially leading to display issues or even security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption due to block gas limit

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The contract uses a function type variable to perform an arbitrary jump, which can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The contract's inheritance order is incorrect, which may lead to unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Write to Arbitrary Storage Location
findings.description: The contract allows writing to arbitrary storage locations, which can lead to unauthorized data modification or manipulation.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature leading to potential replay attacks.
